name: Kevin Plank
bio: He is the founder and former CEO of Under Armour, a leading athletic apparel and accessories company.
Kevin Audette Plank (born August 13, 1972) is an American businessman and philanthropist.
Plank is known for his innovative approach to performance apparel and his entrepreneurial spirit.
He is also involved in real estate development and horse racing.
Plank stepped down as CEO of Under Armour in 2019 but remains the executive chairman and brand chief.
lore: Plank played football at the University of Maryland.
He started Under Armour in his grandmother's basement in 1996.
Plank's initial product was a moisture-wicking shirt designed to keep athletes cool and dry.
He built Under Armour into a major competitor to Nike and Adidas through innovative marketing and product development.
Plank is known for his hands-on leadership style and his passion for sports.
He has invested in various business ventures, including Sagamore Racing and whiskey distillery Sagamore Spirit.

content.text: Kevin, what was the inspiration behind Under Armour?
As a football player, I was tired of wearing sweaty cotton shirts. I wanted to create something that would keep athletes cool and dry, and that's how Under Armour was born.
What's your advice for aspiring entrepreneurs?
Find a problem and solve it. Be passionate, be persistent, and never give up on your vision. And always remember to hustle.
